triplets.resultant: Chromosome aberrations, increased sister chromatid exchanges, increased comet tail length at 300 μg/mL

triplets.evidence: Serum TSH was 5.5±3.1 ng/ml in rats with partial thyroidectomy, Red 3 and DHPN, and 1.5±0.5 ng/ml in rats with partial thyroidectomy and DHPN

triplets.resultant: DNA strand breaks detected as increased comet tail length at ≥1250 µg/mL and 37°C

triplets.evidence: Amaranth (E123) ... were found to exhibit their genotoxic effect directly in Saccharomyces cerevisiae

triplets.chemical_b: Normal human colonic epithelial cells (NCM460 and primary colonic epithelium)
triplets.resultant: Activation of NF-κB with increased phospho-IκBα, nuclear p65, IL-8 promoter activation and ~2-fold increase in IL-8 secretion at 1 µg/mL

triplets.resultant: Upregulation of Bcl10 mRNA and protein; Bcl10 knockdown reduces carrageenan-induced phospho-IκBα (~50%) and abolishes IL-8 increase

triplets.resultant: Altered microbiota composition with reduced diversity and loss of Faecalibacterium prausnitzii and Ruminococcus spp., alongside increased Roseburia spp. and Lachnospiraceae

triplets.chemical_b: Fecal metabolome (short-chain fatty acids and amino acids)

triplets.health_impact: Loss of health-promoting microbial metabolites associated with chronic inflammatory disease risk

triplets.chemical_a: Mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids (E471)
triplets.resultant: Increased incidence of overall cancer, breast cancer, and prostate cancer in high consumers versus low consumers
triplets.health_impact: Higher risks of overall cancer (HR 1.15), breast cancer (HR 1.24), and prostate cancer (HR 1.46) in a large prospective cohort
triplets.evidence: Higher intakes of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids (FAs) (E471) were associated with higher risks of overall cancer… breast cancer… and prostate cancer

triplets.resultant: Increased incidence of overall and pre/postmenopausal breast cancer in high consumers versus low consumers

triplets.evidence: Associations with breast cancer risk were observed for higher intakes of total carrageenans (E407 and E407a)… and carrageenan (E407)

evidence_quality: High (large prospective cohort, detailed additive intake, consistent associations across multiple sensitivity analyses for E471 and carrageenans)

triplets.health_impact: Nutritional deficiency risk (though noted as not statistically significant in clinical context)

triplets.evidence: compared to the non-thickened infant formulas and under the in vitro conditions used, the availability of calcium, iron, and zinc could be decreased in products thickened with locust bean gum

triplets.evidence: compared to the non-thickened infant formulas and under the in vitro conditions used, the availability of calcium, iron, and zinc could be decreased in products thickened with locust bean gum

In general, a dose-dependent decrease in glucose serum concentration and a decrease in the subsequent rebound to hypoglycaemia after dosing were observed.

triplets.chemical_b: Gut microbiota metabolites (branched-chain amino acids and butyrate)
triplets.resultant: Elevated branched-chain amino acids and reduced butyrate with altered microbiota community structure

triplets.evidence: Drug products containing soy lecithin can cause severe allergic reactions in patients allergic to peanuts or soy

triplets.resultant: Partial fermentation to short-chain fatty acids without systemic absorption or adverse toxicological effects at up to 7,500 mg/kg bw/day in mice and 2,500 mg/kg bw/day in rats
triplets.health_impact: No safety concern identified for general population at refined exposure levels; high intakes up to 30 g/day only caused flatulence
triplets.evidence: Acacia gum is unlikely to be absorbed intact and is slightly fermented by intestinal microbiota… No adverse effects were reported in subchronic and carcinogenicity studies at the highest dose tested

evidence_quality: High (comprehensive EFSA toxicological and exposure assessment with clear statements on microbiota fermentation, doses, and lack of adverse effects)

triplets.resultant: Altered microbiota diversity and gene expression, reduced mucus thickness and increased intestinal permeability, with microbiota encroachment and proinflammatory signaling
triplets.health_impact: Promotes low-grade intestinal inflammation and metabolic endotoxemia, aggravating features of metabolic syndrome in animal and human studies
triplets.evidence: CMC and P80 impact the intestinal barrier and structural properties of the mucus, which may contribute to the development of intestinal inflammation

triplets.resultant: Microbiota encroachment, reduced mucus thickness, increased Proteobacteria and Escherichia coli, reduced Bacteroides and Clostridia, elevated LPS and flagellin
triplets.health_impact: Induces intestinal inflammation, obesity, NAFLD and metabolic syndrome features (altered glycemic tolerance, hyperinsulinemia, elevated liver enzymes) in mice
triplets.evidence: Dietary emulsifiers… impact the mouse gut microbiota promoting colitis and metabolic syndrome

triplets.resultant: Disruption of intercellular junctions and increased intestinal permeability, activation of proinflammatory pathways
triplets.health_impact: Favors leaky gut and chronic low-grade inflammation associated with metabolic syndrome and IBD-like lesions in animal models
triplets.evidence: Carrageenan could disrupt the intercellular junctions acting on actin filament and the zonula occludens-1 [ZO-1] proteins

triplets.resultant: Enhanced E. coli adhesion and biofilm formation on the intestinal surface
triplets.health_impact: Promotes dysbiosis and may contribute to inflammatory bowel disease and metabolic endotoxemia in susceptible hosts
triplets.evidence: Maltodextrin… has a direct effect on gut microbiota, enhancing cell adhesion and biofilm formation through the stimulation of multiple E. coli strains

triplets.chemical_b: Gut microbiota (low‑fat vs high‑fat diet mice)
triplets.resultant: Dose‑ and diet‑dependent dysbiosis with decreased Akkermansia, Bifidobacterium, Lactobacillus and increased Escherichia coli, Lactococcus, Flexispira at certain doses; at higher doses in HFD, enrichment of SCFA‑producing taxa
triplets.health_impact: At low dose in low‑fat diet causes low‑grade systemic inflammation and metabolic syndrome features; at high dose in HFD attenuates metabolic disorders and improves insulin sensitivity
triplets.evidence: Low-dose dietary GML… could also cause low-grade systematic inflammation and gut microbiota dysbiosis… high-dose GML supplementation… could attenuate the high-fat diet (HFD)-induced metabolic disorders

evidence_quality: High for mechanistic links in animal and in vitro models (clear quotes on microbiota shifts, barrier disruption, metabolic outcomes); moderate for human data where effects are subtler and doses supraphysiologic (e.g., 15 g/day CMC pilot trial)

triplets.resultant: Hepatocyte necrosis, cytoplasmic vacuolization, karyopyknosis, DNA laddering and elevated caspase-3 activity
triplets.health_impact: Oxidative liver damage with decreased T-SOD and GSH-Px, increased MDA, histopathological injury in a dose-dependent manner
triplets.evidence: Certain concentrations of CA cause oxidative damage of the liver… resulting in MDA level elevation and DNA fragmentation inducing active caspase-3

evidence_quality: High (clear graded-dose mouse study linking citric acid to oxidative stress markers, caspase-3 activation, DNA laddering and histological liver damage with direct quotes)

triplets.chemical_b: Young children consuming slush ice drinks
triplets.resultant: Acute glycerolaemia with glyceroluria, osmotic and metabolic disturbance (pseudohypertriglyceridaemia, hypokalaemia, lactic acidosis, elevated FFA:3-OHB ratio)
triplets.health_impact: Glycerol intoxication syndrome characterised by decreased consciousness, hypoglycaemia, lactic acidosis and metabolic decompensation mimicking inherited metabolic diseases
triplets.evidence: Consumption of slush ice drinks containing glycerol may cause a clinical syndrome of glycerol intoxication in young children, characterised by decreased consciousness, hypoglycaemia, lactic acidosis, pseudohypertriglyceridaemia and hypokalaemia

evidence_quality: High (21-child case series with consistent temporal link to glycerol-containing slush drinks and characteristic biochemical phenotype; clear quoted description of syndrome)

triplets.chemical_a: Inorganic phosphate food additives (E339, E340, E341, E450, E451, E452)
triplets.resultant: Endothelial dysfunction, vascular smooth muscle osteogenic transdifferentiation and vascular calcification
triplets.health_impact: Increased cardiovascular morbidity and mortality in CKD patients and in general population at high-normal serum phosphate levels
triplets.evidence: The main pathophysiological effect of phosphate is vascular damage, e.g. endothelial dysfunction and vascular calcification

evidence_quality: High for epidemiological association and mechanistic vascular data, but based mainly on observational cohorts and experimental models rather than randomized trials

triplets.resultant: Neurobehavioral impairments and brain damage in young mice after 28‑day oral exposure, suggesting potential neurotoxic risk of foodborne SiO2NPs in children
triplets.evidence: SiO2NPs significantly caused the spatial learning and memory impairments… damaged tissue integrity… increased abundances of Firmicutes and Patescibacteria

evidence_quality: High for controlled in vivo mouse data

triplets.health_impact: DNA damage leading to Carcinogenesis (Renal tumors)
triplets.evidence: KBrO3 produced LPO from methyl linolenate, which resulted in the increased formation of 8-OH-dG
